trans-unit.source: Specifies that a SAML assertion is addressed to a particular audience.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> class corresponds to the `<saml:AudienceRestrictionCondition>` XML element, which is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> is one of several <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> that can be used to scope a SAML assertion

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> class to specify a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> is intended for a specific audience and that the issuing SAML authority does not warrant the SAML assertion for other audiences that receive the security token.

The claims for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are expressed as part of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>, which can optionally have a set of conditions affect the validity of the assertion.
One of those conditions is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition>, which specifies that the assertion is addressed to one or more specific audiences.
The issuing SAML authority cannot prevent an unintended recipient from taking action on the basis of the information provided in the SAML assertion.

However, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> class allows the SAML authority to state explicitly that no warranty is provided to such a party in a machine- and human-readable form.

To specify the set of intended audiences, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.Uri%7D%29> constructor that accepts a set of audiences.
To get the set of intended audiences, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> class with the specified set of audiences a SAML assertion is intended for.
This constructor sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contain a set of intended audiences.
audiences is `null`.
Gets the set of audiences a SAML assertion is intended for.

To set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.Uri%7D%29> constructor that accepts a set of audiences.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contain a set of intended audiences.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.

To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`.
Reads the `<AudienceRestrictionCondition>` element from the specified XML reader.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the `<AudienceRestrictionCondition>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML assertion that are defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the `KeyInfo` clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
The `<AudienceRestrictionCondition>` element has a child `<Audience>` element does not have a value.
Writes the `<AudienceRestrictionCondition>` element into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the `<AudienceRestrictionCondition>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in the SAML assertion that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing `KeyInfo` clauses.
writer is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
